-jNWB5v93f4s4HY_Gd4YmA.text: I went to Happy Home Buffet last night with my husband and our granddaughter who is 1yr old.  She loved everything she could get her hands on and seemed to feel very comfortable in the space.  The owners and staff were wonderful and very welcoming.  They mentioned that they intend to add traditional chinese entertainment on weekends in the near future.  I am looking forward to it since it will make them more than just a place to eat!  Many of the dishes were unique and their attention to detail was very good.  Some of the dishes were a little oily for my taste but overall a good time was had by one and all!

J35eBMqnePkNoebHu3BEsQ.text: This place has gone through many name and I'm assuming ownership changes, but it's always been a Chinese buffet. I'd say this is the worst iteration of it that I've seen at this location. The food is average and somehow they stripped all of the character and comfort from the place. It's so bare and uncomfortable in there. You eat in a giant plain room full of tables. There wasn't any music playing, so it was eerily and weirdly quiet. It's like a school dining hall or something. I don't know. Really hard to explain. I wouldn't judge it so hard if I hadn't known how it has looked in the past. Why did they change it so much and make it so bare? I'm focusing a lot on the ambiance here, but the food is pretty average. They seem to do a good job of keeping it all hot, so that's always a positive. There are a few sushi selections and the typical odds and ends you come to expect from a Chinese buffet. It isn't anything memorable, but it isn't the absolute worst either.

v0RI4emb9aBjWiwCd5t9tA.text: No bueno. Dropped some shit on the ground and put that shit back in with other shit. Repulsive. Disgusting. Unstanned.

9FSYUDFhOlOAfgbnCeoW3A.text: Staff was very nice, food was warm, and tasty. The wonton soup was delicious. I would recommend stopping, in if you've got a big appetite.

2jBT4ZJdMIshtjsx_9CW0Q.text: The worst Chinese restaurant I ever been to in my entire life. The food was terrible and tasted bland. A lot of it looked like it was sitting out for awhile so I grabbed what looked fresh. I took a bite of everything off my plate and was so dissatisfied by all of it that I had them take away my plate and waited until my check came. The buffet was way over priced for how awful it was and the manager was completely unprofessional when I informed him how bad my experience was and how I wanted to resolve it. He was VERY RUDE and gave off the impression that he wasn't even a manager from how he was dressed and the dirty looks he was giving. Quote "Go eat somewhere else then". Never again!

ckHG1dK8Izon0VaZkbLGtw.text: I took my friend out for her birthday and she picked this place. Everything was so neat and orderly when we went in, a shiny new penny. The buffet was mostly standard fair but it was very fresh and hot. The fish was amazing, as was the other seafood. We tried to try a bit of everything, but because of the wide variety it was impossible. The cubes of beef were a little tough and needed to be cooked either shorter so they were tender or longer to soften to falling apart.Some more vegetables would be  nice. Next time I'm going to try the sushi and the hibachi, I just didn't have the room to give it a try because I also had the deserts. Two of us ate to our hearts content for only $3617. My friend made up a takeout for her daughter and that was the same price of 16 or so dollars.

PgxIEdbUOL6AWJGZTU9jOA.text: I'm pretty open food wise and I really don't expect a buffet to be amazing. With that being said.... this isn't a good Buffet. I went by the most recent reviews and said I'll give it a chance. Wrong decision! I basically tried something of everything hoping to find something good. Have you ever been to somewhere where cold shrimp with cocktail sauce is bad? I hadn't before this visit. The cocktail sauce was like 5 gallon bucket ketchup with one teaspoon of horseradish. Everything seemed room temperature. The best thing I ate was the clear jelly thing with some purple something in it. Searched it online and it looked NOTHING like it said it was suppose to. The server didn't bring us any other drinks after the check was brought. The check arrived 5 minutes after we sat down. I was coming back with my first plate and it was there. Please just save yourself wasted time and go somewhere else. This was one of the worst meals I have ever eaten and it pained me to pay the $37 for the meal. Never again!

a500djXzNhs1UN1of85K9A.text: It is a very great restaurant with a wide selection of foods and desserts. It has a very nice interior and a very large buffet, as well as a sushi bar, and a hibachi. They have traditional Asian foods as well as more modernized ones. They have a very great staff and many rooms and tables.

ZaUQgp7qkp9X5RivDEMJMA.text: The service here is wonderful! The waiters are very attentive. The decor is also very pretty! The food was the best part though! It had a mix of authentic Chinese food and the sushi/hibachi bar was also very good. Will definitely come here again and recommend to other friends.

GYgbG85WR24dsrzdn_yqoQ.text: Prices too high, food is average.... also the manager passed out cards at a local business on McKnight for 10% off, and the waitresses would not honor them. Maybe you should talk to your staff. also someone in the party was 65 and asked for senior price and the waitress asked for his drivers licence, because she didnt believe him.....not starting out too good here folks................

zp-I6_zAGLXvz5K1Wbz4Vg.text: Very disappointed!!! I used to go to this place often before it was Happy Home Buffet, I think it used to be called Tokyo something. I moved further away so have not been back since it changed its name until today. Anyway, the place before the name was changed was not like this... their buffet used to be excellent, and the sushi were all fresh! They had the sushi chefs right there making them, and the other items on the buffet tables were also fresh and tasty. Today, I was sorely disappointed. Clearly this is under a new ownership, and their business model and philosophy are completely different; the chefs are obviously different. The foods were salty and very greasy, and some tasted old! The only reason I am not giving a one star but giving two stars is because the waitstaff were nice and took my dirty plates right away. One of the worst Chinese buffets I have yet experienced, very disappointed. The sushi were not fresh, I felt sick afterwards. I thought it was weird that the place was not packed like it used to be when I walked in. Now I know why!

vFhxNe3H-7zawA_pIrFRAA.text: Such a pleasant first experience at Happy Home Buffet! Very clean, and visually pleasing environment. Very extensive options to eat. Made to ofer hibachi was delicious, and my boyfriend LOVED his sushi plate. The food was hot and seemed to be very fresh. Staff was very nice and helpful! Would highly recommend!

EjkSZE_2oJYocXskR9Ogtg.text: This place is terrible. The food is stale and the service is even worse. I do not recommend this place, do not waste your money or time going to this restaurant.

jqupJinRk3ITv2FcUEdvrw.text: This has to be one of my FAVORITE buffets I have even eaten at! They have some attentive waiters and service. The best part of this restaurant is that they have scrumptious looking and tasting food! This is an excellent restaurant to spend time with family and friends! This is why you should eat at this delicious buffet!  -Review by a 10 year old-

79mN_rStSp65816v1I6vSg.text: Been there a few times now, from opening night, to now most recently, tonight. The first visit was, Ok, better than TJs, but not WOW. But not bad. Standard fare.  However went tonight, and dare i say, from the sushi to the main dishes, Its actually gotten better! Almost as if the first run was to get the feet wet.  Food was tasty, and they kept it clean and full. Most of the usual suspects you would find on the buffet line, with a few surprises, but all in all, a great experience. Even my daughter, the queen of picky eaters made a few trips. I usually top off at 2 plates, little of my favorites, and finish with soup, This go, i had to try everything. wasn't disappointed.   They even had "Tarot Cake" back in the Dim sum (Gong Xi Fa Cai!) to which my wife wouldn't touch just due to the look. Lol. Its delicious. Try it while ya can, before it goes away post New years ;)  Service is always very friendly and fast, and they're getting busier. Happy to see a place i like picking up steam! (No pun intended.)  As others mention, it is a bit open feeling with the table lay out, but almost feels like a work in progress after a new opening. Small changes from the last few times. Not sure what the stage is there for, LOL, but the TV does offer a bit of Music. Atmosphere would be my only ... not complaint, but eh, it doesnt bother me though ;)

jcOAkQkJkYZnhJiFXun2rQ.text: Went here for the first time. Sushi was so so. Had items like salt and pepper shrimp where you eat the whole shrimp shell and all. Advertise lobster but nothing in shells. Food appeared and tasted over cooked and mushy. Way I determine if food is good is trying egg rolls... they were mushy and no flavor. Not worth the cost.

75X06TZnEhw6jilg58zyQg.text: Excellent! New owners are great. Fresh and delicious. They have great desserts and even some salad. Good selection of sushi as well as duck, seafood, everything!

EXpj2ULWMWFrKS2qYIvcqw.text: This buffet was fresh and had a great selection of seafood and sushi.  One of the best buffets I have ever had.  The owners and staff were very accommodating as well.  A great value

WIjPdSG7gAfBFkzESoky0w.text: Yelp doesn't allow 0 stars, unfortunately, and this place deserves it. First off, the floors were so sticky that I now will never complain about IHOP's floors ever again. The food. Not much to say about it. It wasn't good. Sushi wasn't awful, but I wouldn't go back there for it. A LOT of weird things on the buffet and I'm pretty adventurous with food. Shark fin soup. Yum. Many items were not hot or even warm. Others weren't cooked or were still partially frozen. Ice cream was decent, but there's always Dairy Queen. The total for two people for dinner & pop = $37.88. We've had better food for the value at gas stations. Best part of the night -- seeing the kitchen staff order in pizza (picture posted to prove it).

photos.caption: Photo of Happy Home Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The food is so bad that the chefs ordered pizza...

ewxhYOuqnL_-8jcvw8d5FQ.text: Great Asian buffet. The food is better than the other buffet in this area, and it's cheaper. Definitely will come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Happy Home Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Happy Home Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

bO4wB5whCVQ1aHZTKWkrRA.text: We have been to this restaurant twice since the reopening. We went once with our kids and the second time me and my husband. When it was the four of us, it was a bit pricey. The food is really good and there is a wide variety.  We will visit again.

Ew5qKo4cqcSENYkthDlwxw.text: Stopped here to see how it compared to other 2 Asian buffet that were here.  Just got some buffet takeout so can't completely talk about everything but it looks like things are made in small batches.  That's good as everything tasted fresh.  A lot of your standard fare with a few new items heavy on chicken and fish.  The place itself appeared very clean and well lit.  I think still have some things to iron out but will be going back soon to try the whole buffet.

uysFbLNva7Gwqig394-C-Q.text: So happy a new place opened here, as the location is prime.  I waited a few weeks since the grand opening to eat here, because there are inherently kinks to work out anytime a new business opens.    I came for dinner on Christmas Eve, and the place was quite busy.  At least half the patrons there were Asian Americans, which in my experience is the best telltale sign of the authentic nature and quality of the food.  This was exactly the case.    The food exceeded my expectations, and I think it tops the quality of the food of the large one on the other side of town near the Waterfront.  Food was piping hot, and the entire place was very clean (including the restrooms).    I tried a little bit of virtually every offering, minus sushi, salad bar, and hibachi.  Not a single thing disappointed me.  After probably 8 or 9 plates, I left very full, but not queasy at any point that night or the next day.  They have my trust and my future business, for sure.  I am glad to have this lovely new asset in the North Hills, close to home.  See you in the new year!

IRc4Vp4oM1tYsVXfiG5dbA.text: Good food! We also get 10% off. Many choices including crabs. The waitresses are attentive.

Yh17tWdTBoJE5-itV99BHg.text: Don't waste your time or money. Cold, tasteless food. I wouldn't recommend it as there are plenty of good Chinese restaurants in the area.

_Qs4goHrpb2fw8qBetatyA.text: I feel that this is the worst meal I have ever eaten at a Chinese food restaurant. The best thing on the menu was the plain white rice. All of the food was cold. The egg roll was limp and frankly did not taste like an egg roll. I honestly think the mall Chinese tastes better. The food was mostly empty and I get it but at 8pm on a Saturday night a small scoop of chicken and broccoli and the broccoli tasted like a piece of shoe leather. I wasted 40$.

DjPKirNEPutOMN5-hu_wqA.text: Everything was dry and bland and looks dirty.not switched out time to time. Worst sushi I have ever had. I'm NOT coming here ever again.

cZpKvmRP5Ebo2dBqhwZGmg.text: Decided to give this place a try,  definitely against my better judgement.   First we were the only people in the joint, the food looked old sitting out however we were interrupted to be told that it was now dinner time which in turn means we would have to pay more for the same quality of food.   We started to have hope when we noticed new food was being brought out...our hopes went straight out the door, everything was bland and was not appetizing in the least.   The check finally came and for the two of us it came to $36.00. EXTREMELY way over priced.  We could have went to a nice sit down Chinese Restaurant for that price.   DO NOT TRY THIS PLACE!   Save your money.

4JrfTUtIua5WROV_qyOShQ.text: I like the fish here very much. You can try lots of different style fish. As well as the fruit, they are pretty fresh.

NgEXGt1Dnm89CL79dHYz_A.text: The soup is quite good, and ice cream is also quite nice.  Sushi is fresh and tasty. Service is always wonderful.

beq-ssDzYGpdCG2AMZoi_g.text: Bad bad food. Not fresh empty bins. The one in Homestead is a 1000 times better. They should be ashamed to serve this crap. We should have walked out. In the future when this place closes maybe a good place will open   The crab they served would have made you sick it looked 5 days old. Instead of filling the bins a lady walk around just stirring what was left. We were there just after 2 pm and it should have been well stocked. There is 2 small buffets with 20 things and most of the food was good. This place could not fill 2 bins with good food. I could go on all day and have nightmares all night about it.

qplMjZGO3H2z6Hm7i5Grlg.text: Great place, great food and great services!  The experiences here is kinda mixing many individual merits of buffet restaurants.  Strongly recommend!

njbRcX_jiC7_M0t8mtEErg.text: The service was very good, and what a little lesser than what you would expect from a Chinese buffet lunch for 9.95. It sucked lol. The Sushi was decent but everything else wasn't good. All of the buffet items were cold and the hibachi sauce was AWFUL. I couldn't even eat it and I felt bad for wasting it. Then I moved on to desert- cream puffs were hard. The ice cream selection was super basic (prior to being under this new mgmt there was red bean and green tea ice cream, and that's why it was one of my favorite cheap spots before it changed over. Food was way better too).   The weirdest thing I saw there was there waiting area for when they got busy........ I don't know why, but I feel as though vehicle seats in a restaurant should be against some kind of code or policy somewhere

photos.caption: Photo of Happy Home Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Waiting room seating for when there is a wait for dinner.....

VTZaq5TGcVke5D1nU0-5nw.text: Food quality has been dropping here. It's not just the ingredients but the cooking quality and serving temperatures. I started off with some raw oysters which were pretty good last time I had them here, but this time they were part frozen and had a weird chemical smell. Maybe just a bad supplier? I set those aside and tried some other things, but they were off too. The sauces were all excessively sweet and heavy. The fish for the sushi looked pale and dry suggesting it had been frozen then soaked in water. There were only a couple dishes such as the steamed fish with ginger and scallions that were properly cooked and as good as they've previously been. The bathrooms were also filthy and obviously hadn't been attended to in quite a while.  Sad to say I'm crossing this off my list and not coming back until I hear it's improved and/or under new management.

G7UEc_nHuy8J_m6iHbpmJQ.text: Yikes. Should have turned away when there were only three other cars in the parking lot at a Friday at 6 PM. Walk in and it is a ghost town inside. More workers than customers. There are also mini van seats in the waiting area for some reason. Will say that the staff were very friendly and attentive.  The lack of music gave it a creepy feel.  However, the food simply was not good. Lack of flavor and you can tell the food has been sitting under a lamp all day.  Did not try the sushi because the freshness was questionable. The hibachi inside was a nice touch and better than anything else sitting out there. They also have ramen that you can pick your own ingredients.   TLDR: you're in a major city. There are better places to eat.

_gZg6-pNTcV7pN7sv3kAjg.text: This place deserves all the stars. Admittedly, I did not expect much because this restaurant is tucked away in a shopping complex that has a bunch of big box stores, but I'm so glad I made the journey to try it. When we first walked it, my fiance and I were immediately impressed by how clean the buffet was. The counters were immaculate, the sushi neatly arranged, and the trays fresh and colorful.   The cleanliness was one of the biggest things that stood out to me. I've been to dozens of asian buffets and this is one of the cleanest. The wait staff was also exceptional; whenever I went to get another plate, the mess of the previous plate was also cleared before I got back. I had the chance to talk to Joy, who was so kind and amazing at her job.   At $16 per person for dinner, I think the quality and diversity of the food here is truly discounted. What I loved was that all the trays were small -- indicating that they make small, high quality batches at a time for each dish. Also, having smaller trays meant there were so many things to try! While we were there, I was particularly enamored with the blistered yet crispy green beans and they replenished that particular tray faster than I could eat them!  The other thing I really enjoyed was the crab. They literally serve half-crabs here and they are enormous, juicy, and addicting. I was amazed they served crab for only $16/person. They are the only good Asian buffet in the area and I really appreciate the offerings here. They have high quality food, crab, sushi, and a Mongolian bar -- what more is there to say?

P_qI0-azTC23DmM88tgdbg.text: This is a great place to have Chinese buffet. They have so many different options to choose from, a lot more than typical Chinese restaurants. This place even has sushi! The spicy tuna roll is spectacular, and they have a wide variety of sushi to choose from. A hibachi grill, sushi, many seafood options, a dessert bar, and so many soups. It's so cheap to eat out here to lunch too. Two people is about 25$ I believe. The staff is really nice, and the food is pretty good. I haven't eaten anything from here that I haven't liked. Everything is so fresh too. Nice and hot and you can definitely tell that it's not food that's been sitting out a while. I highly recommend Happy Home Buffet to anyone that's looking to get some Chinese and Japanese cuisine.

lZKatmzPJFeZtLsYsJ-RNg.text: The food is a little dry for my liking. There is a wide variety of food offered here however, nothing out of the ordinary. I came here for the special holiday dinner on a Christmas and paid $27 for typical Chinese food and crab legs. I would not say that it was worth the money.   I only had two plates of food and couldn't even finish the second plate fully. I think that speaks volumes since I typically eat 3-5 plates. I wasn't even tempted by their desserts. Although, the ice cream case seemed nice with a wide variety of options.   I'm not sure if this Chinese buffet differs from any others in the area. I definitely prefer Hokkaido over this one. I'd try this place again if I was really craving Chinese food and desperate for a place that was open.

C6WcGoMlVtwcluo-T7gNjA.text: Not impressed. My family and I came here for dinner. They need to work on the quality of the food and improve their sauces. I'm not looking for a 5 star meal at a buffet but I've definitely had better quality food at other buffets. The sushi was just mediocre, some of the shrimp dishes were overcooked and mushy, and the beef was just okay. Their desserts were good and I liked their variety of ice cream. If they worked on their sauces a bit, I think they would get more patrons.

photos.caption: Photo of Happy Home Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buffet area

bsux4AvD6MHJNosUOBVsKg.text: Awful food, dining room looks like empty plain boring classroom.. what a wast of time and money! Big disappointment

9raLz9ntaPkNLXTe3-bL9Q.text: I had dinner with my friends last night. Service was awesome and the room was comfortable. Food was absolutely wonderful, having fish, shrimp, roasted duck, crab and all kinds of snacks This is definitely the best Chinese buffet in Pittsburgh! Will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Happy Home Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Happy Home Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Happy Home Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

T6I3o16uDbhJXBUwSECHqg.text: This is my first time back since this buffet opened under a new name. I went at 12:45 on a Monday & I was surprised there were quite a few filled tables. The sushi was fresh & tasted great. They don't have as much sushi selection as the last place, but definitely adequate. They will make a stir fry fresh. They have lots of Chinese dishes & dumplings, and several soup options. They have some kids items and American items too like Mac & cheese and chicken nuggets. There is a salad bar & dessert bar with hand dipped ice cream. I was seated immediately & my water was refilled promptly & plates were also cleared promptly. The food was hot. Really, who can argue with a $10.95 All you eat Asian buffet lunch?

photos.caption: Photo of Happy Home Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Front of restaurant from parking lot

a6k6rG4VIrClQbvjHWjd4g.text: Mediocre lunch buffet for a reasonable price. The food wasn't super fresh or hot for that matter. Everything tasted okay, but this is not a place I will be visiting again. I love Chinese buffets, but this is one you can skip.

HOkrzZXdf9IduF_zDIj6AA.text: Nice place, bbq beef and noodle are very good, price is also reasonable. Will come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Happy Home Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

xWbphIaO-xYO-XDIJN3ihQ.text: We tried Happy Home Buffet tonight for their Sunday buffet. It was adequate, but nothing special. It's fairly similar to the last two buffet restaurants that have existed in this location. I was glad for the hibachi option, because there were very few vegetables on any of the steam tables besides one dish of green beans with almonds. They were very good, but I wished for more options and variety. Like bok choy!  We tried a variety of the other entrees and they were fine. A little heavy on sauces for my taste, and mostly very well done, which isn't ideal when it comes to beef, or fresh vegetables. Pretty standard buffet fare.  The staff working tonight were very friendly and helpful. Our server was ever present, and was happy to refill our drinks, answer questions and generally be helpful. The same could be said of the kitchen staff who were busy bringing out fresh food throughout our visit.   Overall, we'd probably come here again a few times per year to add some variety to our eating out options, but it's not a standout in terms of local restaurants.

YFbXmdv5B65nci6ZevWJdw.text: The sushi here is amazing! Well not as good as ur $500 sushi house of course. But the best of all buffet around the area. Definitely putting on my to go list. Looking forward to come here again. Try the hibachi though, u could pick ur own ingredients , u can't go wrong with that.

t0SS0baLjpnPrDv0jbJ2Cw.text: Chef dropped a piece of chicken on the ground picked it up and put it back in with all the other chicken he was preparing. I saw thru the open kitchen doorway. I asked for the manager who said he would check when he came back he said the chef said no no he threw it away. I paid my bill and proceeded to tell him I don't want anything for free I just want him to know. He said come look there is a piece of chicken in the garbage I told him I know what I saw. He didn't care so eat at your own risk.  Ps  I will be calling the health department on this restaurant

Cedj-yJbT8yvxm-jq0Wqhw.text: I went right as they opened up for lunch at 11am and everything was delicious! The lunch price is only $10 which is a great deal. Not only do they have various sushi, Asian cuisine but also the option for hibachi!! I am curious to go back for dinner to see if they fresh taste was just because I was there first thing . Service was great too!

SW3z6C8XIHxvxl8MtWfvzg.text: Great price! Best asian buffet in Pittsburgh!  The food was great, freshly cooked and well presented. Will definitely come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Happy Home Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Happy Home Buffet - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

vhcSy58Z-fF23VdWryo4QQ.text: Pretty much exactly the same as it use to be Tjs sushi and grill. Food isn't real good, the sushi is just ok they have brand new ice creams that's the best food there.

OV50eSyLkopmM_5yMwj1Hg.text: Went last night (Monday) with my son.  Good - the dining room was clean-ish.  Looks like they've not cleaned the interior glass panels for a while, though.  But the table area where we sat was clean.  The young man and young woman who were our servers were friendly and attentive.  The variety of food was really good.  I've never seen octopus or steamed crabs on a buffet before.  There was a great variety of seafood  Bad - I have no idea how this place gets such good ratings.  Perhaps the seafood is really good - I like seafood, and had the salmon, which was ok.  Didn't try the shrimp because it just didn't look right to me - under heat lamps and limp.  Mostly stuck to the chicken dishes.  The General Tso's chicken was soggy and was more sickening sweet than flavorful and spicy.  The sweet and sour chicken, again, soggy breading and sweet.  Plus, I'm pretty sure that there was a deep-fried neck piece in my serving.  The chicken inside was inedible - dry and very stringy.  The chicken and broccoli was ok - although the chicken was like a sponge.  I had a bowl of chicken broth and some noodles.  When I go to buffets, I will ultimately get a salad, but there were a few iceberg lettuce leaves dried up in a buffet pan so I passed.  I get that it was a Monday and the turnover is probably slow, but for $34 for the two of us was a bit much for such poor quality.  We skipped dessert because none of it looked edible.
